articles.title: Etienne Bacher
articles.contents:
Etienne Bacher

              Etienne Bacher
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        GitHub

                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I am a French PhD student in the Doctoral Team Unit ACROSS at LISER, Luxembourg. I study the relationship between cross-border mobility, attitudes and political preferences.
            Besides working on this topic, I also enjoy programming with R by creating Shiny apps or packages that you can find on my GitHub repo. I also write blog articles about R from time to time, that you can find in the “Blog” tab above.
            If you want to contact me, the best way to do so is by email at etienne.bacher@protonmail.com, or via Twitter (though I’m not very active on it).
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Etienne Bacher

              I am a French PhD student in the Doctoral Team Unit ACROSS at LISER, Luxembourg. I study the relationship between cross-border mobility, attitudes and political preferences.
              Besides working on this topic, I also enjoy programming with R by creating Shiny apps or packages that you can find on my GitHub repo. I also write blog articles about R from time to time, that you can find in the “Blog” tab above.
              If you want to contact me, the best way to do so is by email at etienne.bacher@protonmail.com, or via Twitter (though I’m not very active on it).
